Author: CHMEX#0686
Content:
Did anybody get the following while compilling marketmaker?


In file included from exchanges/LP_nativeDEX.c:179:0,
                 from exchanges/mm.c:79:
exchanges/LP_bitcoin.c:20:47: fatal error: sodium/crypto_generichash_blake2b.h: No such file or directory
compilation terminated.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
@CHMEX new system
```
How to build marketmaker etomic (Linux)? (small how-to by Decker) 
----------------------------------------------------------

git clone https://github.com/jl777/SuperNET # better to do a fresh clone
cd SuperNET
git checkout dev
git pull
git submodule init
git submodule update --init --recursive
mkdir mm
cd mm
wget https://cmake.org/files/v3.12/cmake-3.12.3-Linux-x86_64.tar.gz
tar -xvf cmake-3.12.3-Linux-x86_64.tar.gz
./cmake-3.12.3-Linux-x86_64/bin/cmake ..
make -j$(nproc)

How to build marketmaker nonetomic (Linux)? (small how-to by Decker) 
----------------------------------------------------------

git clone https://github.com/jl777/SuperNET # better to do a fresh clone
cd SuperNET
git checkout dev
git pull
cd iguana
sudo apt install libsodium-dev
# open m_mm file
# and change line:
# gcc -g -o marketmaker -DNOTETOMIC -I../crypto777 exchanges/mm.c ../crypto777/cJSON.c mini-gmp.c keccak.c groestl.c segwit_addr.c secp256k1.o ../agents/libcrypto777.a $nanomsg_lib -lcurl -lpthread  -lm
# to
# gcc -g -o marketmaker -DNOTETOMIC -I../crypto777 exchanges/mm.c ../crypto777/cJSON.c mini-gmp.c keccak.c groestl.c segwit_addr.c secp256k1.o ../agents/libcrypto777.a $nanomsg_lib -lcurl -lpthread  -lm -lsodium
./m_mm
```

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Is https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/KomodoPlatform/wiki/barterDEX-API-Summary-by-Category the most up-to-date documentation for the RPC API?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Yes.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Includes all the barterDEX 1.0 API calls.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: you can run `./help` and that will give you all API commands

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: @SHossain I am trying to write a simple market maker, is it possible you or someone else could answer a few questions that I have?  Some parts of the documentation are a little unclear.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: post your questions here and you will get answer

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok, thanks

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Which method should I use to create a market order? `dump`? `fomo`?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `autoprice`, `setprice` `buy` `sell`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `dump` and `fomo` are special cases

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: But `buy` and `sell` require a price, don't they?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: dump and fomo can't place bob orders. those need to be used when there are orders from bob

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `autoprice` and `setprice` is needed to create bob orders

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/KomodoPlatform/wiki/Be-a-marketmaker-or-bob-using-barterDEX-CLI

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: read other docs in the wiki in order to learn more

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: I have read that. I have an Alice and a Bob node set up.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: bob uses `autoprice` or `setprice` and alice needs to use `buy` or `sell`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: alice also can use `fomo` and `dump`

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: but, for that bob orders need to be present

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So can a bob not specify the maximum volume it wants to sell?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: use `amount` field on the autoprice script

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: What about for alice @SHossain ?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: `buy` script

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Can alice place an order without specifying price?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: alice without price use `fomo` or `dump`

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok, thanks. What is the difference between those two?

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: The documentation makes it look like they do the same thing.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: one buys, one sells

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: standard industry terms

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: fomo is buy and dump is sell

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Thank you.

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: The docs say the `buy` endpoint "will be added in the orderbook" if there is no matching order.  But in another spot it says `buy` is fill or kill. Isn't this contradictory?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: BarterDEX is an auction system, not traditional exchange

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: there can be negative spread

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: if you have a winning bid, it will be filled. otherwise, not filled

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: why don't you perform tests first with BEER and PIZZA and learn how it works before diving deep

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: BEER and PIZZA is free coin for testing

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: Ok, thanks

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: barterDEX also doesn't use balance, it uses UTXO

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: So is it not contradictory due to the nature of BarterDEX?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content:
faucets for free coin
https://www.atomicexplorer.com/#/faucet/beer
https://www.atomicexplorer.com/#/faucet/pizza

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it is not contradictory. any `buy` order will put it on the orderbook. it either gets filled or stay there doing nothing

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fill_or_kill

Author: wbradt#2043
Content: But it stays on the order book, it doesn't get cancelled, right?

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: it doesn't get cancelled automatically
